standard_metadata.standard_description: Apply the formulas V = l × w × h and V = b × h for rectangular prisms to find volumes of right rectangular prisms with whole-number edge lengths in the context of solving real world and mathematical problems.

question.content: **What is the volume of the rectangular prism?**       $\text{cm}^3$

images.alt: A rectangular prism. The base is 6 centimeters long and 5 centimeters wide. The height is 7 centimeters high.

hints.content: We want to know how many one-centimeter cubes can we fit in the prism.

### Step 1: Find the area of the base  First, let's figure out how many fit at the bottom (base) of the shape.    [[☃ image 1]]  We can fit $6\times 5=30$ unit cubes at the base.  **Note:** The base of this prism is a rectangle, which is why we call it a rectangular prism. The area of the base is $30 \text{ cm}^2$.

images.alt: A rectangular prism. The base is 6 centimeters long and 5 centimeters wide. The height is 7 centimeters high. There is one centimeter cube located on the front face at the base. Lines are drawn on the rest of the base to show 5 rows and 6 columns.

hints.content: ### Step 2: Multiply by the height of the prism  One layer of cubes has $30$ cubes. But, how many layers fit in the prism?    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A rectangular prism. The height is 7 centimeters. The base is shown as a layer of centimeter cubes arranged in 5 rows and 6 columns.

hints.content: We can fit $7$ layers of cubes in the prism because its height is $7\text{ cm}$.  Multiplying, we get  $30\times 7=210$ cubes  which means the volume of the prism is $210\text{ cm}^3$.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A rectangular prism made up of centimeter cubes. The front face of a rectangular prism shows 42 cubes: 7 rows and 6 columns. The top face of the cube shows 30 cubes: 5 rows and 6 columns. The right slice shows 35 cubes: 7 rows and 5 columns. The length of the rectangular prism is 6 centimeters. The width of the rectangular prism is 5 centimeters. The height of the rectangular prism is 7 centimeters.

hints.content: The answer:  $210 \text{ cm}^3$

question.content: **What is the volume of the rectangular prism?**     $\text{cm}^3$

images.alt: A rectangular prism. The base is 3 centimeters long and 4 centimeters wide. The height is 6 centimeters high.

hints.content: We want to know how many one-centimeter cubes can we fit in the prism.

### Step 1: Find the area of the base  First, let's figure out how many fit at the bottom (base) of the shape.  [[☃ image 1]]  We can fit $3\times 4=12$ unit cubes at the base.  **Note:** The base of this prism is a rectangle, which is why we call it a rectangular prism. The area of the base is $12 \text{ cm}^2$.

images.alt: A rectangular prism. The base is 3 centimeters long and 4 centimeters wide. The height is 6 centimeters high. There is one centimeter cube located on the front face at the base. Lines are drawn on the rest of the base to show 4 rows and 3 columns.

hints.content: ### Step 2: Multiply by the height of the prism  One layer of cubes has $12$ cubes. But, how many layers fit in the prism?  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A rectangular prism. The height is 6 centimeters. The base is shown as a layer of centimeter cubes arranged in 4 rows and 3 columns.

hints.content: We can fit $6$ layers of cubes in the prism because its height is $6\text{ cm}$.  Multiplying, we get  $12\times 6=72$ cubes  which means the volume of the prism is $72\text{ cm}^3$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A rectangular prism made up of centimeter cubes. The front face of a rectangular prism shows 18 cubes: 6 rows and 3 columns. The top face of the cube shows 12 cubes: 4 rows and 3 columns. The right slice shows 24 cubes: 6 rows and 4 columns. The length of the rectangular prism is 3 centimeters. The width of the rectangular prism is 4 centimeters. The height of the rectangular prism is 6 centimeters.

hints.content: The answer:  $72 \text{ cm}^3$

hints.content: ### Step 2: Multiply by the height of the prism  One layer of cubes has $10$ cubes. But, how many layers fit in the prism?  [[☃ image 1]]

hints.content: We can fit $7$ layers of cubes in the prism because its height is $7\text{ cm}$.  Multiplying, we get  $10\times 7=70$ cubes  which means the volume of the prism is $70\text{ cm}^3$.  [[☃ image 1]]

The right slice shows 14 cubes: 7 rows and 2 columns. The length of the rectangular prism is 5 centimeters. The width of the rectangular prism is 2 centimeters. question.content: **What is the volume of the rectangular prism?**     $\text{cm}^3$

images.alt: A rectangular prism. The base is 8 centimeters long and 1 centimeter wide. The height is 5 centimeters high.

hints.content: We want to know how many one-centimeter cubes can we fit in the prism.

### Step 1: Find the area of the base  First, let's figure out how many fit at the bottom (base) of the shape.  [[☃ image 1]]  We can fit $1\times 8=8$ unit cubes at the base.  **Note:** The base of this prism is a rectangle, which is why we call it a rectangular prism. The area of the base is $8 \text{ cm}^2$.

images.alt: A rectangular prism. The base is 8 centimeters long and 1 centimeter wide. The height is 5 centimeters high. There is one centimeter cube located on the front face at the base. Lines are drawn on the rest of the base to show 1 row and 8 columns.

hints.content: ### Step 2: Multiply by the height of the prism  One layer of cubes has $8$ cubes. But, how many layers fit in the prism?  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A rectangular prism. The height is 5 centimeters. The base is shown as a layer of centimeter cubes arranged in 1 row and 8 columns.

hints.content: We can fit $5$ layers of cubes in the prism because its height is $5\text{ cm}$.  Multiplying, we get  $8\times 5=40$ cubes  which means the volume of the prism is $40\text{ cm}^3$.  [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A rectangular prism made up of centimeter cubes. The front face of a rectangular prism shows 40 cubes: 5 rows and 8 columns. The top face of the cube shows 8 cubes: 1 row and 8 columns. The right slice shows 5 cubes: 5 rows and 1 column. The length of the rectangular prism is 8 centimeters. The width of the rectangular prism is 1 centimeter. The height of the rectangular prism is 5 centimeters.

hints.content: The answer:  $40 \text{ cm}^3$

hints.content: ### Step 2: Multiply by the height of the prism  One layer of cubes has $9$ cubes. But, how many layers fit in the prism?  [[☃ image 1]]
